title: Profile: The Scientist Behind the Revolutionary Cancer Treatment
introText: Dr. Elena Rodriguez spent 20 years developing a treatment that seemed impossible. Now her immunotherapy approach is curing cancers that were once death sentences. This is her story.

content.content: Rodriguez's insight came in 2005: the immune system could be trained to recognize and destroy cancer cells. At the time, most oncologists considered the approach a dead end.
Funding was scarce, and early trials failed. Rodriguez persisted through professional skepticism and personal setbacks. 'I knew it would work,' she recalls. 'The biology was sound.'
The breakthrough came in 2023. Patients with terminal diagnoses achieved complete remission. Now her approach is revolutionizing oncology, and Rodriguez is mentioned for the Nobel Prize.
